text: You can join a FaceTime call on an Android
by clicking a link sent to you
by someone with an Apple device.
For Android users to join a FaceTime call,

they will need to have
Google Chrome installed.
First, someone with an Apple device
needs to start the FaceTime call.

To do this, you will need an
iPhone running at least iOS 15,
an iPad running at least iPadOS 15,
or a Mac running at least MacOS Monterey.

The Apple user will need
to open the FaceTime app,
then tap "Create Link."

In the pop-up, select how
you'd like to share the link.
The method you use doesn't matter

as long as the Android
user receives the link.

Once the Android user has the
link to FaceTime.Apple.com,
they need to open it using Google Chrome.
Then enter a name and tap "Continue."
Once joined, the Android user can
tap the green "Join" button
in the floating pop-up.

You might also be required
to give FaceTime permission
to use the microphone and camera.
The Apple user will then need
to accept their request to join.
Once both parties have entered the call,

they'll both have options
to mute themselves,

show or hide their camera,
leave the call, and more.
